title: Web
subtitle: Quiz on HTTP and Web Requests

questions.text: Which HTTP method is used to retrieve data from a server?
questions.explanation: GET is used to request data from a server.

questions.text: Which HTTP method is typically used to submit form data?
questions.explanation: POST is used to send data to a server, such as form submissions.

questions.text: Which HTTP method is idempotent, meaning multiple identical requests have the same effect?
questions.explanation: PUT is idempotent, replacing the same resource each time.

questions.text: Which HTTP status code means 'Not Found'?
questions.explanation: 404 indicates the requested resource could not be found.

questions.text: Which HTTP header is used to specify the format of the body being sent?
questions.explanation: Content-Type specifies the media type (e.g., application/json).

questions.text: Which header indicates the type of response the client can accept?
questions.explanation: Accept tells the server which media types the client can handle.

questions.text: Which protocol is used to secure HTTP traffic?
questions.explanation: HTTPS is HTTP over SSL/TLS.

questions.text: Which status code indicates a successful request?
questions.explanation: 200 OK means the request succeeded.

questions.text: Which status code indicates the server encountered an unexpected condition?
questions.explanation: 500 Internal Server Error indicates an unexpected server error.

questions.text: Which HTTP method is used to delete a resource?
questions.explanation: DELETE removes a resource on the server.

questions.text: Which HTTP method is used to partially update a resource?
questions.explanation: PATCH applies partial modifications to a resource.

questions.text: What does the 201 HTTP status code mean?
questions.explanation: 201 Created indicates a new resource has been successfully created.

questions.text: Which HTTP header is used to send authentication credentials?
questions.explanation: Authorization carries credentials such as tokens or Basic auth.

questions.text: Which HTTP status code is returned when a resource has been permanently moved?
questions.explanation: 301 Moved Permanently indicates a resourceâ€™s URL has changed permanently.

questions.text: What is the default port for HTTP?
questions.explanation: HTTP uses port 80 by default.

questions.text: What is the default port for HTTPS?
questions.explanation: HTTPS uses port 443 by default.

questions.text: Which status code indicates the client is not authorized?
questions.explanation: 401 Unauthorized indicates missing or invalid authentication.

questions.text: Which status code means the client is forbidden from accessing a resource?
questions.explanation: 403 Forbidden means the client is authenticated but not allowed access.

questions.text: Which header is used to store small pieces of stateful information on the client?
questions.explanation: Set-Cookie tells the browser to store a cookie.

questions.text: Which HTTP status code indicates too many requests?
questions.explanation: 429 Too Many Requests is used for rate limiting.
